qas.question: How many options categories display in the standard PS3 XrossMediaBar?
One of Sony's streaming services is the PlayStation Vue; what's the other one called?
When you start up your PS3, what's the first section of the PS Network you see?
What menu would you use to set up a video chat?
What is displayed when the system shuts down?
PS4 is able to store what kind of profiles?
PS4 has what kind of optional storage?
PS4 is compatible with what kind of keyboard?
How many options categories display in the standard PS4 XrossMediaBar?
One of Sony's streaming services is the PlayStation Rue; what's the other one called?
When you start up your PS3, what's the last section of the PS Network you see?
What menu would you use to set up an audio chat?

context: The standard PlayStation 3 version of the XrossMediaBar (pronounced Cross Media Bar, or abbreviated <a0_0><b9_0>XMB<b9_0/><a0_0/>) includes <a1_0><b10_0>nine<b10_0/><a1_0/> categories of options. These are: Users, Settings, Photo, Music, Video, TV/Video Services, Game, Network, PlayStation Network and Friends (similar to the PlayStation Portable media bar). TheTV/Video Services category is for services like Netflix and/or if PlayTV or torne is installed; the first category in this section is "My Channels", which lets users download various streaming services, including Sony's own streaming services <a2_0><b11_0>Crackle<b11_0/><a2_0/> and PlayStation Vue. By default, the <a3_0><b5_0><b12_0>What's New<b12_0/><b5_0/><a3_0/> section of PlayStation Network is displayed when the system starts up. PS3 includes the ability to store various <b6_0>master and secondary user<b6_0/> profiles, manage and explore photos with or without a musical slide show, play music and copy audio CD tracks to an attached data storage device, play movies and video files from the hard disk drive, an optical disc (Blu-ray Disc or DVD-Video) or an optional <b7_0>USB mass<b7_0/> storage or Flash card, compatibility for a <b8_0>USB<b8_0/> keyboard and mouse and a web browser supporting compatible-file download function. Additionally, UPnP media will appear in the respective audio/video/photo categories if a compatible media server or DLNA server is detected on the local network. The <a4_0><b13_0>Friends<b13_0/><a4_0/> menu allows mail with emoticon and attached picture features and video chat which requires an optional PlayStation Eye or EyeToy webcam. The Network menu allows online shopping through the PlayStation Store and connectivity to PlayStation Portable via Remote Play.
